description: From Latin expāns-, past-participle stem of expandere (“to spread out”; see expand) +‎ -ive.

adjectives.description: expansive (comparative more expansive, superlative most expansive)

examples: The Elastick or expansive faculty of the Air, whereby it dilates itself, when compressed (indeed this lower Region of it by reason of the weight of the superincumbent is al∣ways in a compressed State) hath been made use of in the common Weather-glasses, in Wind guns, and in several ingenious Water∣works, and doubtless hath a great Interest in many natural Effects and Operations.
